name: axios
text: Former Joint Chiefs of Staff chairman Mike Mullen writes in The Atlantic that he was "sickened" to see the National Guard use physical force on peaceful protestors to clear a path for Trump's photo op at St. John’s Church yesterday. https://t.co/OaNUhYCJCc

name: axios
text:
A handful of GOP senators scolded Trump over his photo op Monday at St. John's Church.

Sen. Ben Sasse: "I’m against clearing out a peaceful protest for a photo op that treats the Word of God as a political prop." 
https://t.co/OQreQgdbgH

name: axios
text: Texas GOP Rep. Will Hurd has joined a protest against George Floyd's killing, saying: "What we are showing here in Houston is that you can be outraged by a black man getting murdered in police custody. We can be united for change in our society" https://t.co/JE9npEWD1n

name: axios
text:
Workers — especially millennials and Gen Zers — are paying close attention to the words and actions of their employers during national crises, such as the protests following the killing of George Floyd in police custody.

https://t.co/9JhLstjmrC

name: axios
text:
Watch: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau was silent for about 20 seconds when asked to react to scenes from outside the White House, where police yesterday forcefully removed peaceful protesters to make way for a Trump photo-op in front of St. John's Church.
https://t.co/zPhzjbijhr

name: axios
text:
Defense Secretary Mark Esper has told NBC he had no notice that he was being led with President Trump to a photo op at St. John's Episcopol Church this week, saying: "I thought I was going to do two things: to see some damage and to talk to the troops" 
https://t.co/JBFBb3kmL3

name: axios
text: Sec. Mark Esper says had no notice that he was being led with Trump to a photo op at St. John's Episcopal Church, saying: "I thought I was going to do two things: to see some damage and to talk to the troops." https://t.co/37xRTTLFMY

name: axios
text:
Joe Biden has been declared the winner of tonight's primaries in Indiana, Maryland, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, New Mexico and South Dakota thus far.

Biden needs to win 425 of the 479 delegates up for grabs in order to officially clinch the nomination. https://t.co/K7CqZIf2Rn

name: axios
text: Pennsylvania's secretary of state says that approximately 1.8 million Pennsylvania voters applied for and were approved to vote by mail-in and absentee ballot — 17 times greater than the number in 2016. https://t.co/K7CqZIf2Rn

name: axios
text: Voters lined up for hours to cast ballots in presidential primaries across the U.S. on Tuesday, even amid curfews imposed for protests over George Floyd's killing. https://t.co/3moGwcvyfx

name: axios
text: The RNC is officially planning to move its 2020 convention to a new city given the ongoing restrictions in North Carolina due to the pandemic. https://t.co/2AHJlgZIHP

name: axios
text: Theresa Greenfield, the candidate backed by Senate Democrats' campaign arm, has beaten out four other Democrats for the chance to challenge Sen. Joni Ernst, one of the most vulnerable Republicans in the Senate. https://t.co/K7CqZIf2Rn

name: axios
text: Outgoing Montana Gov. Steve Bullock has won his Democratic primary for Senate. He will face off against Republican incumbent Sen. Steve Daines in November. https://t.co/K7CqZIf2Rn

name: axios
text:

name: axios
text: Rep. Greg Gianforte, who won a special election in 2017 after being charged with assaulting a reporter, clinched the Republican nomination in the race to succeed Montana Gov. Steve Bullock. https://t.co/K7CqZIf2Rn

name: axios
